author: Michael Russell | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: John Gorham opening tapas bar in Pine Street Market
text:
Toro Bravo chef John Gorham plans to open a rotisserie chicken joint and tapas bar in the upcoming Pine Street Market .
Pollo Bravo, the latest addition to the upcoming downtown Portland food hall, will feature a traditional Spanish standing bar serving Toro Bravo tapas and rotisserie chicken inspired by restaurants in both Mexico and Spain, including Barcelona's Pollo Rico.
The new project is led by Josh Scofield, who for the past six years has run the commissary kitchen and charcuterie program for Gorham's four restaurants, including Toro Bravo, Tasty N Sons, Tasty N Alder and Mediterranean Exploration Company. Cocktails, from Tasty N Alder bar manager Jeremy Meilen, will blend Spanish-inspired classics with modernist technique. Sarah Scofield, Toro Bravo's floor manager, is also moving over to Pollo Bravo.
Once open, Pine Street Market, one of America's most anticipated food halls , will span the entire ground floor of the United Carriage and Baggage Transfer Building in Portland's Old Town, bringing nearly a dozen Portland restaurants, breweries, bakeries and more together under one roof. Confirmed tenants include Barista, Hopworks Urban Brewery, Patrick McKee, Olympia Provisions, baker Ken Forkish and more. Andina, which was previously announced as a market tenant, has pulled out.
Pine Street Market is expected to open near the end of the year at 126 S.W. 2nd Avenue. Between now and then, look for Pollo Bravo to pop up at Gorham's Plaza de Toro . Keep an eye on oregonlive.com/dining for more details.
